comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Duncan Mac Innes, chief auditor of the Finance Department of the City of New York. He was subpoenaed before the Thompson Investigating Committee, according to The evening world., February 15, 1916, Final Edition, Page 2, col. 3 "CITY PAID THE $125,000 TO PRESIDENT SHONTS". The photo was obviously taken in the same room as this: See also comments under the photo of Senator Thompson

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The 1916 hearings were held at the New York County Lawyers Association Board Room, 165 Broadway New York City. books.google.com/books?id=ZKc3AAAAMAAJ&pg=PA27#v=onep... 165 Broadway was the 30 story City Investing Building, built in 1908 and demolished in 1968. collections.mcny.org/C.aspx?VP3=SearchResult_VPage&VB...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: B-59 and artolog: Thank you for the further background information and the linking to related images. We will add more details to this record.
